subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] online RP pronunciation dictionary
msgSnippet: ... On the contrary I do think I know for a fact that there is none.  I suggest going to bookfinder.com and get a used copy of the Longman Pronunciation
messageBody:
On 2008-10-19 peter_r_guinness wrote:
> Does anyone here know of any online RP pronunciation
> dictionary/resources?

On the contrary I do think I know for a fact
that there is none. I suggest going to
bookfinder.com and get a used copy of the
"Longman Pronunciation Dictionary" by
JC Wells, which includes both RP and GA
pronunciations. In general you'd need the
latest edition only if you can't figure out how
new words like "Iphone" are pronounced.


/BP 8^)>
--
Benct Philip Jonsson -- melroch atte melroch dotte se
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
"C'est en vain que nos Josués littéraires crient
à la langue de s'arrêter; les langues ni le soleil
ne s'arrêtent plus. Le jour où elles se *fixent*,
c'est qu'elles meurent." (Victor Hugo)

On 2008-10-19 peter_r_guinness wrote:
> Does anyone here know of any online RP pronunciation 
> dictionary/resources?

On the contrary I do think I know for a fact
that there is none.  I suggest going to
bookfinder.com and get a used copy of the
"Longman Pronunciation Dictionary" by
JC Wells, which includes both RP and GA
pronunciations.  In general you'd need the
latest edition only if you can't figure out how
new words like "Iphone" are pronounced.


/BP 8^)>
